metadata.title: CVE-2019-10131 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
An off-by-one read vulnerability was discovered in ImageMagick beforeversion 7.0.7-28 in the formatIPTCfromBuffer function in coders/meta.c. Alocal attacker may use this flaw to read beyond the end of the buffer or tocrash the program.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10131` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm9
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm9
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm9
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm9
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm9
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm9
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm9').
